zombies.name: Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Zombie hates how his name makes him seem like an ordinary, well, zombie. He doesn't think of himself as some unnamed enemy or just another common corpse. He's an individual, damn it! And he's going to do something extraordinary, even if it kills you.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Regular Garden-variety zombie.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>50/0.5 (biting)</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270</color>

zombies.name: Conehead Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Conehead Zombie has no clue what a traffic cone is. To him, it looks like an ice cream cone, and when he finds out it can't eat it, he just sticks it on his head.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>His traffic cone headpiece makes him twice as tough as normal zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 370 (Type 1)</color>

zombies.name: Pole Vaulting Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once the best high jumper in his town, Pole Vaulting Zombie's career took a turn the day he forgot to set up the cushions behind the high jump stand.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Pole Vaulting Zombie vaults with a pole.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Jumps over the first plant he runs into. Can be blocked by tall plants.</color>

zombies.name: Buckethead Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once upon a time, Buckethead Zombie, who was merely a painter, was hailed as a genius among zombies for his creative use of a bucket. Years have passed, and now the zombies wonder if he still has some secret killer tricks up his sleeve. Is he running out of ideas, or is he hiding something? Who knows?</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>His bucket hat makes him extremely resistant to damage.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 1100 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Bucket can be removed by Magnet-shrooms.</color>

zombies.name: Newspaper Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"You can't fault him for being frustrated; he was just about to finish the crossword puzzle (vertical word number 23 is 'Brains'), which explains why he was holding the paper upside down."</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>His newspaper provides limited defense.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 200 (Type 2)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Travels normally at first, but speeds up after losing his newspaper (movement speed ×2.5, attack speed ×1.5).</color>

zombies.name: Dancing Pole Vaulter
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Dancing Pole Vaulter's athletic skills are average by zombie standards. On the advice of the Backup Pole Vaulters, he decided to pursue the idol path. Now, his pop song "Just Brains," a collaboration with Michael Jackson, is becoming a hit.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>After vaulting over, summons his Backup Pole Vaulters.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Summons 4 Backup Pole Vaulters after jumping. Does not summon if the jumping is blocked.</color>

zombies.name: Backup Pole Vaulter
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The four brothers, once troubled orphans, developed twisted personalities and bullied others at the Zombie Academy. One day, they saw Dancing Pole Vaulter performing joyfully on stage, and it changed them. From that moment, they joined him in performing on stage together.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Climb over a plant.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Jumps over the first plant he runs into. Can be blocked by tall plants.</color>

zombies.name: Screen Door Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Screen Door Zombie, once an FBI task force member with a bad temper but a righteous heart, never negotiated with robbers—he'd just break down doors to save hostages. After becoming a zombie, his kind heart stayed the same. When he saw zombies kidnapping a little ghost zombie, he tried to break in, but they coated the door with glue, trapping his hand.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Can block bullets coming from the front.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 1100 (Type 2)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Screen Door can be removed by Magnet-shrooms.</color>

zombies.name: Football Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Football Zombie is a sports star among zombies, admired by many for his heroic presence on the field. Many companies want to hire him, but his salary demands are steep—an annual pay of 10,000 brains.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Runs super fast.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 1400  (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Football Helmet can be removed by Magnet-shrooms.

zombies.name: Michael Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Black suit, black hat—he's not here for a funeral. He's just a dancer, and you can call him Michael Zombie.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Leads the charge with his ultimate dance moves.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Summons 4 Dancing Pole Vaulters at a time, keeps summoning if a Dancing Pole Vaulter dies. Does not summon while eating.</color>

zombies.name: Duck Zombie NOT IN GAME
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>只有特定的僵尸才能成为鸭子救生圈僵尸，不是每只僵尸都能胜任。有些救生圈有点漏气，他们却处理不了，脱身后永远放弃了对脑子的渴求。</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>可以在水里移动。

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270</color>

zombies.name: Coneduck Zombie NOT IN GAME
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>都说差生文具多，但是路障鸭子并不这么认为，毕竟他不想承认他是个差生。</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>可以在水里移动。

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 370 (Type 1)</color>

zombies.name: Bucket-duck Zombie NOT IN GAME
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>铁桶鸭子本不想带上那个漏气的游泳圈的，但是没办法，谁叫他戴着那个容易生锈的铁桶呢。</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>可以在水里移动。

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 1100 (Type 1)</color>

zombies.name: Zombarine
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The formidable Zombarine, designed based on bionic principles, is both majestic and intimidating—a coveted war weapon for zombies. "Now we just need to tackle the issue of seaweed getting tangled in the propeller," said Dr. Edgar.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>The zombies' premier vehicle against water plants.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1350</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Moves fast and sinks any plant it comes to contact with, dealing 500 Damage to anti-crush plants..

zombies.name: Scholar Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As a leading authority in the academic realm, Scholar Zombie is frequently seen in the library. His passion for reading runs deep, and disturbing him while he reads can spark his fury. This old gentleman will make sure you understand the true meaning of "knowledge is power."</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Deals huge damage alongside his sturdy books.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>400</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720 +1100 (Type 2)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Short-term invincibility and increased speed (movement speed ×10, attack speed ×3) after his book is broken.</color>

zombies.name: Zomboni
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The zombie driving is an excellent driver, especially considering that few zombies can navigate from the ice rink to the grass field. Now, he must go pay the fine. The ice machine he operates isn't a Zamboni; it's a Zomboni produced by Company B.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>The Zomboni applies ice, steam and pressure to your plants.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1350</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Immune to Chill and Deep Chill.

zombies.name: Snorkel Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Snorkel Zombie may have a broken mask, but that doesn't hinder his ability to dive and float in the water. His so-called "sinking" isn't due to his diving skills; he simply doesn't require air to breathe.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Snorkel Zombie can swim underwater.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Submerges to avoid straight-firing projectile attacks.</color>

zombies.name: Bobsled Zomboni
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>This car, designed by ski enthusiasts, drives smoothly on snow and ice, even achieving higher speeds than on grass. Unfortunately, it has a flaw: it can only be started on icy surfaces.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Only appears when there's ice on the field.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>2700</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Moves very fast when on top of ice. Immune to Chill and Deep Chill.</color>

zombies.name: Dolphin Rider Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Dolphin Rider Zombie is a part-time performer and dolphin keeper at an aquarium. The dolphin he rides is a zombie, but unlike typical zombies, this "zombie dolphin" has no desire for brains.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Dolphin Rider Zombies use dolphins to bypass your defense.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Jumps over the first plant he runs into. Can be blocked by tall plants.</color>

zombies.name: Trident Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Trident Zombie was originally just a regular javelin thrower who became a fisherman after retiring. However, when he went to the river to fish, he sank because he couldn't swim. When he came ashore, he realized he had become what he is now.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Throws a trident to attack your plants.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>6-9s after entering or when blocked, throws a trident, causing damage to plants equal to 20% (minimum of 60) of their current Toughness.</color>
<color=black>Minimum Search Range: </color><color=#4B0082>3.5 Tiles in Front</color>

zombies.name: Diamond-box Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Tonight, Diamond-box Zombies will unveil their dazzling world. Their eyes shine like the brightest stars in the night sky, and the golden light appears to flow like a river through time, illuminating the uncertain path ahead. Each time the lid of the box is gently opened, it feels like unlocking a door to another realm.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Is this.. a Conehead Zombie? 

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>2000 + 4400 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Turns into a Gold-box Zombie upon dying.</color>

zombies.name: Gold-box Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Underneath the golden box, other boxes in different colors await. Can you guess what the box inside is made from?"</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Is this.. a Conehead Zombie? 

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>2000 + 2200 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Turns into a Silver-box Zombie upon dying.</color>

zombies.name: Silver-box Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Silver-box Zombie thinks of the box on his head as a pot, so it must be one. Given his mindset, why don't you grasp his perspective? And you do see the exclamation mark on his box, right?</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Is this.. a Conehead Zombie? 

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>2000 + 1100 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Turns into a Conehead Zombie upon dying.</color>

zombies.name: Jack-in-the-Box Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Although Jack-in-the-Box Zombie is a mental patient, the circus welcomed his application. Be wary of what's in his toy box; it's sure to scare you.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>This zombie carries an explosive surprise.

<color=black>Explosion Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>1 Million</color>
<color=black>Explosion Radius: </color><color=#4B0082>1.375 Tiles (≈ 3×3)</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Will sometimes explode and insta-kill surrounding plants.</color>

zombies.name: Balloon Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Balloon Zombie, one of the Zomppelin creators, frequently gets asked why he's tied balloons to himself. His usual reply is, "That was my conclusion." However, the truth is that the balloons simply got tangled by chance.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Balloon Zombie floats above the fray, immune to most attacks.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 20 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Cannot be damaged by most plants while flying.</color>

zombies.name: Zomppelin
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Zomppelin, Dr. Edgar's latest creation, is quickly becoming the zombies' trusted ally. Speculation abounds about who will pilot this powerful weapon—perhaps the imp or even the airship itself? "It's just a balloon," Dr. Edgar remarked. "Zombies need to keep up with the times. I'm even considering turning it into a drone to avoid embarrassment when defeated by plants."</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Drops deadly bombs as it flies over your plants.

<color=black>Bomb Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>500</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1350</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Drops Jack-in-the-Box Bombs every 3s to the plant directly below. Can be pushed back half a tile by Blovers.</color>

zombies.name: Whale Rider Yeti
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The white whale that Yeti Zombie rides has impressive jumping skills. Dolphin Rider Zombie is quite envious and has always wanted to borrow it for a ride, but Yeti Zombie refuses each time. "Yeti Zombie has no control over his white whale," Dr. Edgar said. "He always wants to hide behind me, but the white whale ends up going the other way."</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Jumps forward three tiles and turns back, attacking your plants from behind.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Cannot be blocked by tall plants.</color>

zombies.name: Digger Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>A long time ago, Digger Zombies despised Magnet-shrooms for constantly confiscating their tools. Now, they hate Miner Pumpkins even more. "My head keeps getting hit, which makes me feel even worse," he laments.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>This zombie digs to bypass your defenses.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Tunnels underground and appears on the left side of the lawn. Vulnerable to Magnet-shrooms and fully-armed Potato Mines.</color>

zombies.name: Bucknut-copter Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Friends, did you know about the Berlin airship? It inspired my design..." All the zombies want to hide from Bucknut-copter Zombie, not only because he talks too much about the airship, but also because the noise from his balloon's propeller is unbearable.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Bucknut-copter Zombie is immune to Blovers!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 500 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Immune to Blovers. Gains a Type 1 Bucknut Helmet with 2200 Toughness upon touching ground.</color>

zombies.name: Clown-in-the-Box Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>For every clown zombie, self-destruction is the highest form of art, and Clown-in-the-Box Zombie excels above all. "Clown-in-the-Box Zombie will never take off his mask or let go of the gift box in his hand!"</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Clown-in-the-Box Zombie may also explode after his death!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720 + 370 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Becomes violent after exploding, doubling his speed. Upon defeat, has a chance to explode and transform into a Jack-in-the-Box Zombie. The longer it is on the lawn, the higher the chance.</color>

zombies.name: Catapult Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Nobody knows how Catapult Zombie manages to throw with such precision, but one thing's for sure—if you see him, cover your head quickly!</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Catapults basketballs to attack your plants.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>60/3s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>850</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Throws basketballs at the leftmost plant in its lane. When all 25 basketballs are used, moves forward and crushes plants.</color>

zombies.name: Pogo Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sproing! Sproing! Sproing! That's the sound of a powerful and effective zombie doing what he does best.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A zombie that can leap over your defenses.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Can jump over plants. The Pogo Stick can be removed by Magnet-shrooms.</color>

zombies.name: Ladder Zombie
zombies.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>Ladder Zombie heard online that with a ladder and some work clothes, he could sneak past any defenses. Armed with a ladder and dressed like a worker, he sets out to conquer the plant defenses.
Peashooter's comment: "Didn't anyone tell him that his zombie skin is way too noticeable...?"</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>This zombie uses a ladder to bypass obstacles.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720 + 720 (Type 2)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Can use the ladder to ignore plant defenses. Laddered plants cannot be moved by gloves. Ladders can be destroyed by Cremators. Ladder can be removed by Magnet-shrooms.</color>

zombies.name: Pogo Melon Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Quote: "It's highly unlikely for shells to explode in the same crater twice! This is what 'Crater Theory' states." Pogo Melon Zombie says while adjusting his melon peel hat. However, no one told him that his red-and-green color scheme stands out a bit too much in a crowd of zombies.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>This zombie charges up and leaps into your defenses!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 2200 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Charges up for 5 seconds, then performs a big jump (about 4 Tiles long).
<color=black>Weakness: </color><color=#4B0082>Umbrellas</color>

zombies.name: Gargantuar
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Gargantuar is like a massive, clumsy beast, its size an advantage at the cost of intelligence. It doesn't understand plants or brains; it only knows how to move forward, relentlessly. </color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A massive, slow-moving zombie that crushes everything in its way with its enormous size.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Throws an Imp upon reaching half health. Deals 500 Damage to anti-crush plants, 50 Damage to Spike Rocks and 1800 Damage to hypnotized zombies each slam.</color>

zombies.name: Giga Gargantuar
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Although the Giga Gargantuar wreaks havoc on the battlefield, its blood-red eyes instilling fear in all who face it, there's a little-known secret: the monster is perpetually irritable due to chronic sleep deprivation.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>The enraged Gargantuar crushes everything in its path with terrifying strength.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>6000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Inherits all traits from regular Gargantuars.</color>

zombies.name: Imp
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Imps enjoy sneaking through tight spaces, often causing mischief. Don't be surprised if you see one bouncing around unexpectedly!</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Small and sneaky, Imp loves to squeeze into tight spaces, making him agile and harder to target.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>While in the air, can be flung out of the screen by the Ultimate moves from some Umbrella fusions.</color>

zombies.name: Mecha Gargantuar
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>A zombie from the popular Plant Girls vs Zombies.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Another invention by Dr. Gargantuar, full-metal and will stomp on your defenses without hesitation.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to most status effects.
<color=black>•</color> Crushes plants, deals 500 Damage to anti-crush plants and 150 Damage to Spike Rocks.  Deals 1000 Damage to hypnotized zombies every second.
<color=black>Weakness: </color><color=#4B0082>Magnet-shroom</color>

zombies.name: Giga Mecha Gargantuar
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>A zombie from the popular Plant Girls vs Zombies.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A latest creation by Dr. Gargantuar, this machinery of doom slowly approaches with steady steps.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>6000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Inherits all Traits from regular Mecha Gargantuars.</color>

zombies.name: Mecha-nut Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Mecha-nut Zombie doesn’t have time for small talk—literally. With every turn, crash, and slope-assisted sprint, it’s all about momentum. "Gotta keep rolling, gotta keep crushing," it mutters in a tinny, robotic voice, steam hissing from its joints. Plants unlucky enough to be in its path? Flattened. But even machines have limits—when it finally grinds to a halt, the Imps inside spill out, ready to pick up where their rolling fortress left off.
zombies.info:
<size=36>A rolling bowling ball on the zombies' side.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1350</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Switches lanes when hitting plants, speeds up on slopes. Slows down after switching lanes.
<color=black>•</color>Crushes plants that has less than or equal to 1000 Toughness, and deals 1000 damage to tougher plants.
<color=black>•</color> Spawns 5 Imps upon death.
<color=black>•</color> Has equal probablities to drop an ice ball, fireball, or Mecha Fragment.
<color=black>•</color> The balls can crush plants, block up to 30 bullets, and last 30 seconds. Can be countered by Ice-/Fire-based plant fusions.
<color=black>Weakness: </color><color=#4B0082>Umbrellas</color>

zombies.name: Armored Gargantuar
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Armored Gargantuar is a big fan of a skin called 'Cavalier' from his favorite game. So, he spent a fortune custom-ordering a set of medieval armor tailored just for him. However, when he tried to take it off, he found it was stuck for good... And that's how he ended up with a permanent 'Cadavelier' skin.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Spawns Imps every time he smashes with his mace!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>8000 + 24000 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Moves at half the speed of regular Gargantuars.
<color=black>•</color> Takes a maximum of 5000 damage per hit before damage reduction calculations.
<color=black>•</color> Immune to being hypnotized, devoured and knocked back, other status effects only last half as long.
<color=black>•</color> Throws a Mecha-nut ball when its Toughness is at half, spawning 5 Imps when it breaks.
<color=black>•</color> Spawns 1-3 Imps every time he slams the ground with his mace.</color>

zombies.name: Dr. Zomboss
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Edgar George Zomboss achieved his Doctorate in Thanatology in only two years. Quickly mastering thanatological technology, he built his fearsome Zombot and set about establishing absolute dominance of his local subdivision.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Dr. Zomboss rules them all.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>60000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Drops a trophy upon defeat. Incoming damage is capped at 5000 before reduction. Immune to most status effects, except Chill, Freeze, and Enflamed. Has multiple attack modes:
<color=black>•</color> Deploys regular zombies on the right half of the lawn.
<color=black>•</color> Stomps on plants in the rightmost 4 columns.
<color=black>•</color> Releases rolling ice and fireballs that crush plants in a lane.
<color=black>•</color> Drops 3 Bungee Zombies on the left half of the lawn.
<color=black>•</color> At half health, starts to throw campers that crush all plants in a 2x3 area.</color>

zombies.name: Bungee Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Bungee Zombie loves to take risks. After all, what's the point of being dead if you don't live a little?</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Descends from the sky and steals a plant. Prioritizes Pumpkins.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Weakness: </color><color=#4B0082>Umbrellas</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifier:
</color><color=#4B0082>Gains a 90% damage reduction, and can now drop Ultimate zombies as close as column 5 (excluding Diamond Mystery-boxes and Mini-bosses).</color>

zombies.name: Dr. Zomboss Auric Prime
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. In non consectetur odio, ac consectetur dui.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Plants vs. Zombies: Fusion Edition

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>60000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Inherits all traits from Dr. Zomboss. Additionally, disables player's gloves and mallet on appearance. Mallet is unlocked at 2/3 health. Gloves are unlocked at 1/3 health. Thrown campers also clears the conveyor belt.</color>
<size=36>Fusion Formula: <color=#4B0082>Dr. Zombie + Trophy</color>

zombies.name: Yeti Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Many details about Yeti Zombie remain shrouded in mystery. His past? Classified. His motives? Unknown. The only things on record? His name, birth date, social security number, education, work history… and an unwavering passion for roast beef sandwich sandwiches.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Yeti Zombies can sometimes run away.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1350</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Freezes plants in a 3x3 area around it. Jalapenos, Torchwoods and Ice-shrooms are immune to this effect. May carry Puzzle pieces in Odyssey: Evolved.</color>

zombies.name: Nian Zombie
zombies.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>To celebrate the New Year, the zombie party sends out Nian Zombie, the embodiment of festive spirit.

"Look at my new clothes! Don’t I look just like a lion dancer? Pretty nice, right? Now, time to give my New Year's greetings to the plants!"

Unfortunately for him, the plants were too polite. After a flurry of cheerful “thank yous”, Nian Zombie found himself promptly swept away—whether he liked it or not.
zombies.info:
<size=36>Nian Zombies have very strong armor.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>8888 + 8888 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Weakness: </color><color=#4B0082>Bamboom deals 15× Damage to Nian Zombies.</color>

zombies.name: Frost Legion Snowball Launcher
zombies.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Snowball fight!" Snowball Launcher Zombie wakes up from his icy slumber, flinging snowballs wildly in every direction.

"Should we tell him?"
"Nah, let’s see how long it takes him to figure it out."

SMACK!—Another snowball lands.

"That makes fourteen."</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Snowball Launcher Zombie can attack your plants with snowballs and freeze them.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>20/2s</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to Chill and Freeze. Vulnerable to Deep Chill.
<color=black>•</color> After appearing, it will continually launch snowballs at plants, which will deal 20 damage and explode upon impact, disabling plants for 5s in a 3×3 range. Snowballs inflict 10 Cryo points to hypnotized zombies affected.</color>
<color=black>Weakness: </color><color=#4B0082>Umbrella Rind</color>

zombies.name: Frost Legion Shieldbearer
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Frost Legion Shieldbearer was once an elite soldier on the battlefield. Now retired, he’s the reigning champion of the graveyard snowball fight tournament. He treasures the shield that brought him so much glory, constantly checking it for scratches—though some say that very habit might be what got him injured and retired in the first place.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A shieldbearer from the snowy plains, he deflects straight-firing projectiles and returns them as snowballs.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720 + 2200 (Type 2)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to Chill and Freeze. Vulnerable to Deep Chill.
<color=black>•</color> Raises shield every 1.5s to reflect straight-firing projectiles as snowballs. Takes 20 damage when reflecting and does not block the projectile. Delivers shield bashes instead of biting when holding the shield, dealing 50 damage.</color>

zombies.name: Frost Legion Trident Thrower
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>At the ongoing 5th Undead Olympics Winter Games, Frost Legion Trident Thrower hogs all the spotlight. He plans to use his prize money to buy a new sled for himself and his crew—and maybe treat them to a luxurious foot massage to make up for all the damage from stepping on Spikeweeds.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>From the snowy plains comes the Frost Legion Trident Thrower — silencing foes with every icy toss!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to Chill and Freeze. Vulnerable to Deep Chill.
<color=black>•</color> Inherits traits from Trident Zombie. Ice Tridents are not attracted to Umbrellas and apply Silence for 5s on hit.</color>

zombies.name: Chronoporter Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>What exactly is behind the portal held by the Chronoporter Zombie? No zombie really knows — nor do they care to find out. But when their old pals start crawling out one after another, they're more than happy to step up and ask if there's any fresh brains inside.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A force beyond time and space, drawn from the edges of reality itself.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>20/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 200 (Type 2)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Fires chrono peas at your defense. Every 6s, randomly summons a regular, Conehead, Buckethead, or Screen Door zombie from the portal. Drops a Chrono Core upon death.</color>

zombies.name: Frost Legion Floating Disk
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Before every liftoff, the crew of the Floating Disk spends half an hour clearing snow and ice — and dragging out the Snowfurs hiding in the corners. "Getting this frozen lump off the ground eats up a ridiculous amount of fuel," the pilot grumbles.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>It’s snowing! This chilly guest drifts in with flurries, silences plants, and leaves with backup.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Immune to Blover. Creates snowflakes while moving, silencing plants below. Slows down over time — when speed reaches zero, reverses direction. Upon exit, summons a Frost Legion Squad: one each of Shieldbearer, Snowball Launcher, and Trident Thrower Zombies.</color>

zombies.name: Frost Legion Blockhead Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"In the freezing Snowy Plains, keeping warm is essential. In fact, ice makes a great insulator," Blockhead Zombie proudly tells the others—but no one takes his advice. He doesn't seem to notice that ice is also a great soundproofing material.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A legionnaire zombie wearing an iceblock helmet.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>500 + 370 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Immune to Chill and Freeze. Vulnerable to Deep Chill.</color>

zombies.name: Snowfur
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Research into the biological classification of Snowfurs has seen little progress. After all, you can't expect zombies—who lack brains—to be academically sharp. Most can’t even tell a real Snowfur from a Yeti Zombie in a Snowfur pelt. Thankfully, Dr. Edgar offered a brilliant method: 'The smarter-looking one is the Snowfur.'</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A neutral creature native to the snowy plains.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1350</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>When zombies destroy an Iceblock with no corresponding Zombotany, a Snowfur appears. Moves very slowly, crushes plants, but does not directly attack.</color>

zombies.name: Elder Snowfur
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Stronger, wiser, and with a heavier tail than other snow beasts, what truly made him leader was his remarkable leap — guiding his kin to the source of the frozen waterfall.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Apex of the snowy plains.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>When zombies destroy an Iceblock with no corresponding Zombotany, a Snowfur appears, with a 1/4 chance of it being an Elder Snowfur. Moves very slowly and crushes plants. Dashes 2 tiles forward on appearance, ignoring plants.</color>

zombies.name: Miner Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I don’t want to live in this world," Miner Zombie laments, finding no joy in his monotonous life. He just wants to dig up enough obsidian to build a portal and leave. Not to mention that the other side of the portal is even more dangerous and monotonous, he has no chance of lighting the portal at all. The only known ignition tool is guarded deep inside ancient pyramids found in only two locations of the world, where torch-bearing zombies roam.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Wields a random pickaxe to mine through your defense.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>50 (non-biting)</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720 + 1400 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Attacks accumulate mining progress against defensive plants, insta-killing the plant with it reaches 100%. 
<color=black>•</color> Mining progress = (number of attacks × pickaxe damage) / plant HP.
<color=black>•</color> On appearance, randomly receives a pickaxe with different pickaxe powers. When targeting plants with Toughness below their pickaxe powers, pickaxe damage is multiplied by 5.
<color=black>•</color>Pickaxe Types:
	Gold Pickaxe: 150 damage | 4000 power
	Iron Pickaxe: 50 damage | 16000 power
	Diamond Pickaxe: 100 damage | 32000 power
<color=black>•</color> Defensive plants: Nuts, Pumpkins, Burger Blaster, Pearmafrost.</color>

zombies.name: Dolphinhead Newspaper Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>He once dreamed of becoming a mermaid, but the surgeon who was supposed to fix him got his top and bottom halves completely mixed up.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Gets angry when his reading is interrupted... then goes home to fetch another tabloid.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720 + 720 (Type 2)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>After losing his tabloid, greatly increases speed and reverses direction. Upon exiting on the right, spawns a brand new Dolphinhead Newspaper Zombie. This does not trigger if he's hypnotized.</color>

zombies.name: Dolphinhead Football Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>This guy moves like a fish in water on the football field. Wait! It's supposed to be a metaphor! Who said you could flood the lawn!?</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Moves across the field with nimble strides, eager to show off his stylish helmet.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720 + 1400 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Ignores plant collision while wearing his helmet. Upon reaching the first column or the edge of the lawn, he restores all HP, equips a new helmet, and reverses direction.</color>

zombies.name: Furling
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Though just a cub, Furling has big dreams — to dominate the tundra like the mighty Elder Snowfur, not hang around with mischievous Imp Zombies. It ran off from camp to make a name for itself… and accidentally rolled into the plants' territory. Oof!</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A baby Snowfur that loves to tumble, but rarely survives it.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>300</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Rolls forward. Upon hitting a plant, deals damage equal to its current HP, then dies.
<color=black>•</color> Has a 2/3 chance to evade attacks.</color>

zombies.name: Peashooter Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The ability of Peashooter Zombie to engage from a distance often frightens the plants. However, the real panic lies with the zombies, who fear that those fighting in front of him will be targeted from behind.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Shoots peas to attack your plants.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>20/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270</color>

zombies.name: Cherryshooter Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cherryshooter Zombie is a 17-year-old high school student with a plant head growing from his neck. His favorite fruit is cherries, and due to his papal family background, the zombies affectionately refer to him as the "Leaf King."</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Shoots cherry bullets to attack your plants.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>60/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>500</color>

zombies.name: Explod-o-shooter Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Explod-o-shooter Zombie loves listening to "Cherry Bomb" by The Runaways, which might explain his fiery passion. However, no one knows how he learned to ignite fireworks with his mouth.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Shoots explosive cherries to attack your plants.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>1000/10s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>500</color>

zombies.name: Wall-nut Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Following an assault by the plants, Wall-nut Zombie displayed bite marks on his head instead of bullet holes. When interviewed, he said, "Perhaps my comrades were simply hungry."</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>It's a moving nut.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 1100 (Type 1)</color>

zombies.name: <size=30>Cherryshooter Newspaper Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>This zombie's favorite fruit is cherries, and even his newspaper is cherry-flavored. The newspaper he holds is the only thing that can temper his rage.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Goes into an explosive cherry barrage when his newspaper is broken.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>1000 (explosive cherries)</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1500 + 200 (Type 2)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Becomes temporarily invincible after its newspaper's broken, then proceeds to shoot explosive cherries every 0.75s.</color>
<color=black>Explosion Range: </color><color=#4B0082>Cross Splash, can be absorbed by Wall-nuts and Pumpkins at Difficulty 4 or lower.</color>

zombies.name: Mystery-box Zombie
zombies.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>Mystery-box Zombie came to be when an unassuming zombie put on a tattered cardboard box. It quickly realized there was a set of clothes waiting to be used, but couldn't quite put them on because the box didn't have eyeholes.

- Written by Hazy</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>No one knows what's hiding inside the box.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 370 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> After the box falls off, spawns a random non-Odyssey zombie with 20/40/60/80/100/120% of the original zombie's Toughness.
<color=black>•</color> There is a 1% chance that a random Odyssey Modifier will drop when its box is dropped, up to 1 per minute.</color>

zombies.name: Buck-nut Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Why is Buck-nut Zombie's head made of iron? It's because everyone said that eating walnuts nourishes the brain, but he didn't realize that the walnuts he consumed were packed with too much iron. However, it might not be so bad—at least now he has developed an iron head.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>It's a moving Buck-nut.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 2200 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Drops a Bucket when killed by projectiles.</color>

zombies.name: Cherry-nut Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Real men never turn around to watch explosions, and Cherry-nut Zombie certainly fits the bill, as he often catches bombs with his face.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Has a slight resistance against explosive bullets.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 1100 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Takes 150 maximum damage from Cherry Bombs, and receives half the damage from explosive cherry projectiles. Immune to on-death freeze from Frozen Cherries.</color>

zombies.name: Buckshooter Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Last year, Buckshooter Zombie drew a tarot card that read "The Emperor." Since then, he has been able to shoot iron peas at will.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Fires high-damaging bullets.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>80/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1350</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Fires buckshot peas at your defense, these can knock back hypnotized zombies. Drops a Bucket when killed by projectiles.</color>

zombies.name: Football-nut Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Football-nut Zombie was once just an ordinary Football Zombie, until one day he collided with a nut that was spreading fertilizer. "I don't know how this guy ended up on my head; it's suffocating me!" lamented Football-nut Zombie.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>High-armor zombie that can also run very fast.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 4400 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Drops a Football Helmet when killed by projectiles.</color>

zombies.name: Golden Mystery-box Zombie
zombies.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>Golden Mystery-box Zombie just can't make up his mind. One moment, he wants to dress up as a Buck-nut Zombie. The next, he's invested in reading like Scholar Zombie. Perhaps swatting that box off his head will help him make a decision...

-Written by Hazy</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A golden one!? I wonder what's inside this Mystery-box...

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 720 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>After the box falls off, spawns a random non-Odyssey zombie with full Toughness. Also has a chance to unlock an Odyssey Modifier when defeated, up to 1 per minute.</color>

zombies.name: Frost-nut Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Frost-nut Zombie's head has sparked numerous opinions in the zombie world. Some say he aims to distance himself from the cold world, while others suspect it relates to Dr. Edgar's wild experiments. Yet, only he knows that this headgear appeared after he ate a specific blue mushroom.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A sturdy zombie that can also nullify the Chill effect from ice projectiles.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 2200 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Immune to chill and freeze.</color>

zombies.name: Explod-o-pult Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Warning: If you see him running low on basketballs, it's already too late! His explosive shots aren’t just for scoring points—they’re for total chaos! Better start running!</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Throws explosive basketballs to destroy your defenses!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>60/3s (basketballs), 1000/3s (explosive basketballs)</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1350</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Throws 5 basketballs, then launches explosive basketballs (has 20 in total). Explosions deal 100 damage to Umbrella plants.</color>

zombies.name: Pea Rider Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><size=36><color=black>When asked what sets him apart from the Whale Rider Yeti, Pea Rider simply shrugs and grins. "Oh, nothing much. I just really, really love playing Boomerang."</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A variant of the Whale Rider Yeti!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>20/0.75s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Shoots peas at your plants before and after jumping.</color>

zombies.name: <size=30>Screen Door Buckshooter Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Screen Door Buckshooter Zombie loves piling on layers of iron gear, much to the confusion of his fellow zombies. "If Magnet-shrooms can yank off our helmets, why not just wear MORE metal?" he reasoned. His logic seemed sound—until he met the Magnet Blover and learned that sometimes, less is more.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Buckshooter Zombie has acquired some new equipment: a bucket and a screen door!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>80/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1350 + 1100 (Type 1) + 1100 (Type 2)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Cosntantly shoots iron peas at your plants whilst having decent defense. These can knock back hypnotized zombies.</color>

zombies.name: Squash Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Hmm? Hmm!" That’s all the warning you get before the Squash Zombies charge forward, flattening everything in their path. Other zombies admire their dedication, mistaking it for selfless bravery. In truth, they’re just die-hard fans of Nyan Squash—and after watching her crush the Endoflame, they couldn’t resist copying their idol.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Crushes the first plant nearby and dies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>500</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Crushes the first plants it encounters. Converts to a Spicy Squash Zombie when affected by the explosion of a Jalapeno Zombie.</color>

zombies.name: Spicy Squash Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>No zombie is as hot-headed as Spicy Squash Zombie—literally. The second he stomps onto the scene, he shoves others aside, ready to stand tall and declare, "Ashes to ashes!" Unfortunately, his head had other plans… and launched itself off before he could finish.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Leaps and destroys a whole lane of plants!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1500</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Crushes the first plant it encounters and sets the whole lane on fire, destroying all plants affected. Does not set fire if chilled. Does not damage hypnotized zombies or clear ice trails.</color>

zombies.name: Jalapeno Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>With a fiery leap, Jalapeno Zombie cannonballs into the pool, sizzling on impact. The other zombies groan. "Fantastic. Now we're marinating in spicy broth."</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>This zombie explodes and destroys a whole lane of plants after a while.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>500</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Explodes and destroys a whole lane of plants after a while (1M Damage). Does not damage hypnotized zombies or clear ice trails.</color>

zombies.name: Pea Commando Football
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>They say fate is unpredictable, and Pea Commando Football would have to agree. One second, he's in a vegetarian batting cage. The next? He's accidentally ingested a high-powered pitching machine. Now, his new un-life is just one endless round of rapid-fire peas.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Unleashes a relentless barrage of peas at your defenses!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>20/0.1s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 1400 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Constantly shoots volleys of peas at your plants.</color>

zombies.name: Buckshoot-copter Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Faced with doubts from fellow zombies, Buckshoot-copter tried to prove his veteran status with an old group photo. "But… where are you in this?" they asked. He stared at the black-and-white film, just as puzzled.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Buckshooter Zombie hanging from a rotor.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>80/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1350 + 500 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Immune to Blover. Fires buckshot peas at your defense, these can knock back hypnotized zombies. </color>

zombies.name: Doom-shroom Zombie
zombies.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>The zombies have had enough of being blown to ashes by Doom explosions. Now they've finally built a nuclear counterattack weapon to make the plants suffer for a change. Although a zombie's body can only carry a third of the Doom-shroom's full payload, it's still better than nothing, right?

- Written by Mr. Etc.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Doom-shroom zombie? Aw man!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1350</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Self-destructs after a while and creates a Doom-shroom explosion that deals 1800 damage to plants in a 3×3 area.
<color=black>Weakness: </color><color=#4B0082>Doom-nut</color>

zombies.name: Mystery Gargantuar
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Mystery Gargantuar stumbles with a box on his head, maybe to keep you guessing, or maybe to shield his rare, patchwork eyes from the world. Whatever's inside, it's a mystery wrapped in a smash waiting to happen.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Who knows what's waiting for us under that paper mask?

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000 + 1100 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Smashes plants and turns into a random Gargantuar when his mask is destroyed.</color>

zombies.name: Turbo Gargantuar
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Turbo Gargantuar is always at the forefront in pursuit of fresh brains. Thanks to his outstanding record, Dr. Zomboss once personally awarded him the Second-Class Tombstone Medal. Sadly, as an exemplary warrior, he never gets to join the zombie parade, as his stride just never matches the others.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Fast-moving Gargantuar.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Has ×2 the attack speed, movement speed and throwing speed of a regular Gargantuar.</color>

zombies.name: Broody Gargantuar
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Broody Gargantuar swings his power pole, and Imps swarm out from under the ground. These little troublemakers bring plenty of fun, but headaches, too, to their master's life… especially right after he's cracked open a Wall-nut.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Gargantuar that summons Imps with every smash.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Every time he successfully smashes a plant, an Imp is summoned.</color>

zombies.name: Volley Gargantuar
zombies.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>Volley Gargantuar is a descendant of the Sloth Gargantuar from the Frostbite Caves. Those before him have thrown different things, from throwing Jack-in-the-box Zombies to throwing other Gargantuars. He thought he should go back to the roots and throw more Imps, 5 to be exact, a testament to his lineage.

-Written by Medineer Gaming</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Gargantuar with more Imps hiding on his back.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Throws 5 Imps at once.</color>

zombies.name: Parkour Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>He's world-famous for his flashy moves and masterful skills, but none of that matters to him. After all, only humans care about handing out fancy titles for fame and talent. What's that got to do with a zombie?</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A tough, smug parkour enthusiast who, once locked in, swerves and sprints with a burst of speed.

<color=blue>Xiaoxiaosu Collab Zombie, exclusive to Vasebreaker</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>9527</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Switches lanes and speeds up by 3× when HP drops to 2/3.</color>

zombies.name: Sharkmarine
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"An excellent diver should not only be able to dive but also drive a super submarine!" declared Sharkmarine Zombie as he increased the submarine's horsepower by one gear.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Gfishtus Corps proudly presents...

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Charges at a fast speed through your pool defenses, instantly crushing plants that are not immune to it, dealing 500 Damage to anti-crush plants.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#4B0082>1. Zombarines and Sharkmarines now have double the movement speed.
2.  Zombarines and Sharkmarines now gain a 50% Damage reduction.</color>

zombies.name: Michael Zomboni
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Michael Zomboni isn't just a one-zombie act—it takes a whole team to put on the show! Zomboni preps the stage, Bobsled Zombie brings the flashy visuals, and Michael Zombie? Well, he had to step out of the car since he technically didn't have a driver's license. He wanted to greet his adoring plant fans, but... the peas looked a little too enthusiastic.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Extremely high defense and immunity to slow.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>12000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Upon death, automatically spawns a Michael Zombie, Zomboni, and Bobsled Zomboni.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#4B0082>1. Michael Zomboni now appears in every wave and spawns an extra Superstar Zombie on death.
2.  Michael Zombonis and Jackson Worldwides have their movement speed ×5.</color>

zombies.name: Giga Trident-nut Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Giga Trident-nut Zombie is a skilled fisherman known for his exceptional accuracy with the four tridents he throws, earning him the title of the king of fishermen. "In fact, I used to be a part-time javelin thrower..." Giga Trident-nut Zombie admitted.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Throws a large number of tridents at your plants at once.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>270 + 7500 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>6-9s after entering or when blocked, throws 4 tridents, each causing damage to plants equal to 20% (minimum of 60) of their current Toughness.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#4B0082>1. Trident Damage ×5.
2. Now targets random plants outside of minimum range.</color>

zombies.name: <size=30>Gatling Cherry Newspaper Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm getting old..." Gatling Cherry Newspaper Zombie lamented while walking through the street. Despite containing his pressure, it was enough to keep both plants and zombies down. "Only that guy can still inspire me to fight..." he muttered as he put away the newspaper and ambled on.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Deals immense damage.

<color=black>Damage:</color><color=#4B0082>400 (biting) 1000 (cherries)</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1500 + 1500 (Type 2)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Invulnerable until his newspaper is destroyed. Becomes temporarily invincible after its newspaper's broken, and proceeds to shoot 4 explosive cherries every 0.5s.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#4B0082>1. Now ignores plants when enraged.
2. Now immune to status effects.</color>

zombies.name: Giga Football-nut Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Stepping out of the shadows, the Giga Football-nut Zombie radiates power, coldness, and a sinister vibe. He adamantly keeps the secret of his strength to himself, asserting that only the darkest darkness can create a being as formidable as he. "Where is my paint?" Dr. Edgar asked, looking perplexed in his laboratory.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>An old friend? Maybe, perhaps we have met him before.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>100</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000 + 12000 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#4B0082>1. Plants bitten by Giga Football-nut Zombies and Giga Football Strikers cannot regenerate HP for 1 second.
2. Plants bitten by Giga Football-nut Zombies and Giga Football Strikers receive triple the damage for 1 second.</color>

zombies.name: Kirov Zomppelin
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Was that a huge flying object? No, it was actually a gigantic airship, featuring a sturdy shell and the ability to release a squadron of fighters. Even when destroyed, the airship could still wreak havoc on surrounding creatures, causing other zombies to keep their distance, fearing that a crash might send them to their demise.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>An aircraft carrier being developed by Gfishtus Corps.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Summons a Kirov Drone into action every second. Crashlands upon death, dealing immense damage to plants on impact.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#4B0082>1. Zomppelins and Kirov Zomppelins now have their movement speed ×5 and become immune to Blovers.
2. Each Kirov Drone Toughness increased to 25k.</color>

zombies.name: Kirov Drone
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>This is no ordinary aircraft; it is a special plane that has been compressed through water pressure. While the exact method of compression remains a mystery, its battlefield strength rivals that of conventional bombers.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Kirov drones fly faster, releasing bombs over the plants they fly over.

<color=black>Bomb Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>500</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>500</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Immune to chill and Blovers. Drops Jack-in-the-Box Bombs to the plants directly below every 3s.</color>

zombies.name: Superstar Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Superstar Zombie, a legendary idol in the zombie world, has extremely high standards for himself. After completing his studies at Edgar's Dance Academy, he mastered the Super Moonwalk, which was named "The Sixth Wonder of the Zombie World," earning him a large fanbase.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A fast-moving zombie that slides into your defense, a tough opponent to face.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Slips into the battlefield, reduces damage by 90% while sliding, then summons 4 Dancing Pole Vaulters.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#4B0082>1. Michael Zombies and Superstar Zombies now ignore plants when entering the lawn.
2. Now summons 4 Super Dancing Pole Vaulters instead.</color>

zombies.name: Undying Wraith
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>This monster survived the harshest conditions and possesses enormous strength. It avoids brains and roams the world in search of a secluded place.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A wraith from a thousand years ago, with immense strength.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>500</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Every 8~14s, dashes forward 2 tiles, dealing 500 damage to plants in its path (first dash is ×2 faster). Upon death, deals 500 Jack-in-the-Box explosion damage to plants in a 3×3 area, excluding Pumpkin-protected plants.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#4B0082>1. On-death explosion now deals physical damage (cannot be immunitized against).
2. Dash CD reduced to 1/3, base attack damage x3.</color>

zombies.name: Clown-in-the-Pogo Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"What, this? Just fashion, my friend," Clown-in-the-Pogo Zombie smirks whenever his appearance is brought up. But those who've known him long enough don't buy it. His look isn't just about style—it's a quiet, unspoken tribute to a love that once meant everything. Some trends fade, but some memories never do.</color></size>
zombies.info:
<size=36>The bomb is hidden in his pogo stick.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>720 + 4400 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Inherits traits from Pogo Melon Zombie. If he dies while holding his pogo stick, he'll explode and transform into a King Jack-in-the-Box Zombie.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#4B0082>1. On-death explosion is now guaranteed | Pogo Melon Zombies and Clown-in-the-Pogo Zombies have their charge time reduced to 0.75s.
2. Jack-in-the-Box Zombies affected by the explosion will turn into Clown-in-the-Pogo Zombies.
<color=black>Weakness: </color>Umbrella fusions</color>

zombies.name: Giga Mecha-nut
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Fish balls? Mecha armor? That's all that matters," says Giga Mecha-nut. Sporting an impressive mechanical suit, he feels that's all he really needs.</color></size>
zombies.info:
<size=36>The new electric steam roller robot designed by Gfishtus Corps.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1350</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Inherits traits from Mecha-nut Zombies. Super fast. Drops a Giga Mecha-nut Fragment upon defeat.
<color=black>Weakness: </color>Umbrella fusions.</color></size>

zombies.name: Grounded Sharkmarine
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Why is it here? Did it emerge from the groud? Or did it fall from the sky? No one really knows. What is certain is that those displaced dirt looking thingies are definitely camouflage.</color></size>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A failed example of a Sharkmarine test.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>20/0.02s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>Giga Mecha-nut HP/3</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Sharkmarine, but on land and immobile. Using a Wall-nut seedpacket on a Giga Mecha-nut summons a hypnotized Sharkmarine. The Grounded Sharkmarine dies instantly if the Giga Mecha-nut summons again or is destroyed.</color></size>

zombies.name: <color=#4B0082><u>Abyssal Gargantuar</u>
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>By ancient writ, it is recorded that the abyssal obsidian armor may only be borne by a body tempered through trials of bitter frost and searing flame. When the kin of zombies art plunged into utmost peril, his visage may yet appear at the heart of the dreadest battlefield. 'Stir not great commotion, lest ye rouse the giant that slumbereth beneath the earth.' A warning to the plants.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>An ancient, eldritch and insidious threat.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>32000 + 32000 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Mini-boss. Provides a 90% damage reduction (80% in Odyssey: Evolved) to all zombies on screen, spawns Abyssal Imps when he smashes the ground, and inherits other traits of the Armored Gargantuar.</color>
<color=#8B0000><u>Mini-bosses: </color></u><color=#4B0082>Mini-bosses receive only 5000 damage from insta-kills. Immune to hypnotization, devouring, drowning, cremators, transmutation, shrinking, chronoshift and teleporting. Grants all zombies 20% damage reduction (stack up to 90%). Only appears in waves of some levels with more than 3 flags. In Odyssey: Evolved, they have ×2 HP and provide a 70% damage reduction.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#4B0082>1. Summons Dr. Zomboss on death.
2. Spawns with a selected Mini-boss.</color>

zombies.name: Abyssal Imp
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Blades whirling, wings flaring, Abyssal Imp delivered a death-defying stunt straight out of Hollytomb's next big hit, Jurassic Zombies. Critics called it "a masterpiece of aerial choreography." The truth? He had been flung out by mistake and was just rolling with it. Literally.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Abyssal Imp can easily infiltrate your defense.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>200</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1500</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Charges forward 2.7 tiles on appearing, cannot be targeted during the charge but can be flung away by Utimate moves from Umbrellas.</color>

zombies.name: Gatling Explod-o-rider Zombie
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Gatling Explod-o-rider Zombie always wakes up in a terrible mood — especially when a whale riding colleague drags him to work. Fueled by rage, he's ready to blow away any plants in his path before heading back for a nap.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Jumps into and demolishes from behind your defense by shooting explosive cherries!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>1000</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1500</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Starts to shoot 4 explosive cherries every 1.5s, 3s after entering your lawn.</color>

zombies.name: Diamond Mystery-box Zombie
zombies.introduce: A master of cosplay, Diamond Mystery-box Zombie knows how to act as tough as the big shots of the zombie league. The only thing stopping them from pretending to be Dr. Edgar Zomboss is the paralyzing fear of encountering the actual Dr. Edgar. -Written by Hazy
zombies.info:
<size=36>Randomly spawns one of your worst nightmares, or a blessing perhaps?

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>20000 + 1100 (Type 1)
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>After the box falls off, spawns a random Odyssey zombie with 80/100/120% Toughness. Also has a chance to unlock an Odyssey Modifier when defeated, up to 1 per minute.</color>

zombies.name: Trident Hwacha
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Trident Hwacha Zombie is a "perfectionist" of the undead. He thinks his vehicle is a bit shabby, so he starts loading it up with tridents. But true to his perfectionist nature, he won't stop until every slot is filled.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Launches a salvo of tridents at your defense each volley!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>1350 + 4400 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Each attack launches 4 tridents in quick succession, then after a brief pause, he fires another 4 tridents, for a total of two volleys. The tridents don't target plants directly; instead, they are launched at a fixed angle and speed, dealing damage to any plants they hit.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#4B0082>1. Immune to status effects, now fires ×5 the amount of Tridents.
2. Can now launch Tridents from off-screen.</color>

zombies.name: Super Dancing Pole Vaulter
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The zombies cheer as Super Dancing Pole Vaulter defies gravity yet again. "Oh, you know, just talent," he winks. But behind that effortless showmanship? He's clocking in two shifts a day, training until even his undead legs ache. The secret to greatness? "Twice the grind, twice the air time!"</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Can jump over two tiles. Blockable by tall plants.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Inherits all other traits from Michael Zombie.</color>

zombies.name: <color=#4B0082><u>Pozeidon</u>
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The sea splits apart as Pozeidon ascends, water cascading from his mighty form. His trident, crackling with the fury of the deep, is already poised to strike. "The tides are mine to command," he roars, his voice carrying over the howling winds. With a swift motion, the weapon hurtles forward, crashing into enemy lines like a tidal wave. "Run if you wish—but no one outruns the sea."</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>King of the drowned.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>24000 + 24000 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Mini-boss. Immune to stuns.
<color=black>•</color> Summons Giga Trident-nut Zombies on all lanes upon its appearance.
<color=black>•</color> While present, all Odyssey Trident Zombies will continuously attack. Buffs all tridents to deal 5 times more damage than normal.
<color=black>•</color> His tridents are thrown at a fixed angle, instantly killing most plants. It can still be redirected to plants that mitigate damage.
<color=black>•</color> The trident will explode and kill all nearby plants 30 seconds after it lands.</color>

zombies.name: <color=#4B0082><u>Ultra Mecha-nut</u>
zombies.introduce: The Ultra Mecha-Nut was meant to be a smaller, precise Giga Mecha-Nut, but a blueprint mix-up made it much bigger. The engineers noticed too late—so they just rolled with it.
zombies.info:
<size=36>Secret artifact of the Gfishtus Corps.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>90000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Mini-boss.
<color=black>•</color> Inherits traits from Giga Mecha-nut.
<color=black>•</color> Takes a maximum of 100 damage per hit after damage reduction calculations.
<color=black>•</color> The Ultra Mecha-Nut Zombie soaks the damage for all zombies (except Mystery-box Zombies).</color>

zombies.name: <color=#4B0082><u>Giga Football Striker</u>
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>There was no escaping him. Giga Football Striker moved with unnatural precision, his unblinking eyes scanning for the next victim. He wasn't just a destroyer—he was a harvester, a nightmare that took more than just life. Every plant he touched became part of him, twisted and corrupted. And as he advanced, his presence whispered the same terrifying truth: "No matter where you run, I will find you."</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Giga Football Striker can tear down your defense with ease!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>200</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>24000 + 24000 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Mini-boss. Immune to knock-backs and stuns.
<color=black>•</color> Disables plant healing, converting it to 0.1× damage against himself, capped at 1% of his max HP.
<color=black>•</color> Instantly kills non-defensive plants when he bites them, turning them into Giga Football-nut Zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Every 3s, damage ×2 (stackable, max 1M), restores 6000 armor HP, and increases speed by 30% (max 3 times the original speed).</color>

zombies.name: <color=#4B0082><u>Skystrider Mecha</u>
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The battlefield trembled as Skystrider Mecha rolled in, its mechanical frame gleaming under the dim light. "Engaging ground assault," it announced, crushing plants like twigs. But the true horror began when it took to the skies. "Aerial dominance achieved," it declared, summoning Kirov Zomppelins and dropping bombs with surgical precision. "Your defenses are obsolete."</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Lift off! We have a lift off!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>15000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Mini-boss. Immune to knock-backs and being downed by Magnethorn's special traits.
<color=black>•</color> Very fast on land, crushes plants.
<color=black>•</color> At 2/3 Toughness, it briefly becomes invincible then takes off, summoning a fleet of Kirov Zomppelins every 3s and dropping Jack-in-the-Box bombs.</color>

zombies.name: <color=#4B0082><u>Jackson Worldwide</u>
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The spotlight flickered as Jackson Worldwide stepped forward, his grin sharp and his voice low. "You think this is a game?" he said, snapping his fingers. Superstar Zombies materialized, their instruments screeching. "This garden's my stage now. Let's see how long you last."
zombies.info:
<size=36>Jackson Worldwide has dedicated his entire life to the passion of stage performance and touring.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>48000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Mini-boss. Immune to all status effects.
<color=black>•</color> Crushes plants.
<color=black>•</color> Takes a maximum damage of 480 when affected by spikeweed-like attacks.
<color=black>•</color> Grants cryo-immunity to zombies nearby and summons 4 Superstar Zombies and 4 Super Dancing Pole Vaulters periodically.
<color=black>•</color> Spawns 2 Michael Zombonis and a Superstar Zombie upon death.</color>

zombies.name: <color=#4B0082><u>Professor Cherryz</u>
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As Dr. Edgar's mentor, the esteemed Prof. Cherryz exudes an air of refined calm and grace in his speech. But he is obsessed with the studying of scientific artifacts, especially explosives; rumors has it that Cherrizilla was originally his creation...</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>A research-obsessed scholar who now has his eyes on you.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>1000</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>6000 + 15000 (Type 1) + 3000 (Type 2)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Mini-boss. Immune to knock-backs.
<color=black>•</color> Invulnerable until his newspaper is destroyed. Upon losing it, he briefly becomes invincible and converts up to 30 zombies into enraged Gatling Cherry Newspaper Zombie. He then fires a cherry barrage, catapulting cherries to the last column while accelerating forward.
<color=black>•</color> Stops only upon encountering Spikeweed, which instantly destroys his newspaper.</color>

zombies.name: <color=#4B0082><u>Queen Jill-in-the-Box</u>
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Queen's gaze alone is enough to make her servants tremble. None dare defy her. But power is not her only delight—she loves to give. Within her ornate gift box, toys and trinkets await young hands... along with bombs primed to surprise. And oh, how she loves surprises.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Queen Jill-in-the-Box is very keen on creating "explosive scenes."

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>48000</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Mini-boss. Immune to being hypnotized or devoured.
<color=black>•</color> Crushes plants.
<color=black>•</color> Explodes on death, dealing physical damage.
<color=black>•</color> Emerges from her box at regular intervals, causing one of the following effects at random:
1. Summons Clown-in-the-Box zombies on every tile of the fifth column and each column to its right.
2. Same but summons Clown-in-the-Pogo Zombies instead.
3. Releases an explosion in her column, dealing physical damage.</color>

zombies.name: Giga Buckshot Commando
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Giga Buckshot Commando is a warrior made of iron — iron body, iron will, iron bullets, and an ironic attitude towards complaints from his colleagues. He firmly believes that the zombies being knocked back by his bullets must simply lack the kind of iron-refining training he’s undergone.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>An unstoppable warrior. Fearless and peerless.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>80/0.1s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>3000 + 3000 (Type 1)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>Immune to Knock backs. Fires buckshot peas at your defense at a ridiculous rate, these can knock back hypnotized zombies. </color>

zombies.name: Alpha Assassin Squad
zombies.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Alpha Assassin Squad moves like shadows, striking faster than a breath and leaving no trace behind—except for the occasional zombie body, of course. They never miss a target, and they never leave anyone alive to tell the tale.</color>
zombies.info:
<size=36>Typically operating in pairs, with elite members deploying as a full squad when necessary.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#4B0082>500 × 2</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#4B0082>6000 + 6000 (Type 2)</color>
<color=black>Traits: </color><color=#4B0082>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to being hypnotized. Appear in pairs. When appearing as a miniboss, 5 spawn in one lane at once, with their health increased by 5×.
<color=black>•</color> If they take fatal damage while any member of the group is still alive, they become incapacitated. Otherwise, the whole squad dies simultaneously.
